metadata.title: CVE-2017-6961 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in apng2gif 1.7. There is improper sanitization of user input causing huge memory allocations, resulting in a crash. This is related to the read_chunk function using the pChunk->size value (within the PNG file) to determine the amount of memory to allocate.

criterions.comment: apng2gif package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8-0.1').
